title: Job offer letter
prompt: Generate a comprehensive IT-sector job offer letter for [Company Name] to [Candidate Name] for [Job Title] in [Department] at [Location], start date [Start Date]. Include: CTC table with fixed/variable/benefits, ESOP (if any), probation terms, notice period, working hours, leave summary, remote/hybrid policy, background verification and medical fitness contingencies, confidentiality, IP assignment, non-solicitation, data privacy (India + [State] Shops & Establishments), code of conduct, acceptance deadline, required documents, and annexures (CTC breakup, policy acknowledgments). Use clear headings, numbered clauses, and a formal, precise tone.

title: Appointment letter
prompt: Draft an appointment letter confirming employment of [Employee Name] as [Job Title] at [Company Name], joining on [Start Date], reporting to [Manager Name]. Define role scope, grade/band, probation/confirmation criteria, compensation reference to offer annexure, place of posting, transferability, working hours, holidays, leave, performance review cycle, confidentiality, IP, conflict of interest, compliance with [State] Shops & Establishments and IT/ITES norms, and termination/notice provisions.

title: Joining letter
prompt: Create a formal joining letter from [Employee Name] to [Company Name] confirming joining on [Date] as [Job Title], acknowledging receipt of offer/appointment, agreeing to terms, enclosing mandatory documents (KYC, PAN, Aadhaar, bank, education, experience), and declaring no conflicting obligations.

title: Internship offer / Letter of intent
prompt: Draft an internship offer/LOI to [Intern Name] for [Internship Role] in [Team] at [Location]/remote from [Start Date] to [End Date]. Cover stipend, schedule, mentor, learning objectives, deliverables, confidentiality, IP ownership, academic credit (if any), conduct, device/access policy, and exit/extension terms.

title: Probation confirmation letter
prompt: Write a confirmation of employment for [Employee Name], confirming successful completion of probation on [Date] for [Job Title]. Mention performance summary, confirmation effective date, any compensation change, updated benefits eligibility, and next review cycle.

title: Probation extension letter
prompt: Draft a probation extension for [Employee Name], citing specific performance areas, extension duration [X months], measurable goals, support plan, review cadence, and consequences (confirmation or separation).

title: Employment verification letter
prompt: Create an employment verification for [Employee Name], [Job Title], employed from [Start Date] to [End Date/Present], at [Company Name], [Location]. Include employment type, current CTC (if consented), and HR contact.

title: Promotion letter
prompt: Draft a promotion letter elevating [Employee Name] from [Current Title] to [New Title] effective [Date]. Include rationale, new role scope, grade/band, revised compensation, reporting line, and expectations for the first 90 days.

title: Salary increment letter
prompt: Write an increment communication for [Employee Name] detailing revised CTC effective [Date], with table showing old vs. new components (fixed, variable, allowances), performance basis, and payout timelines.

title: Variable pay/bonus payout letter
prompt: Prepare a variable pay letter for [Employee Name], specifying plan name, performance period, achievement metrics, payout amount, tax treatment, clawback (if any), and payment date.

title: Transfer/relocation letter
prompt: Draft a transfer letter moving [Employee Name] to [New Team/Role/Location] effective [Date], with reporting manager, reasons, relocation benefits (if applicable), grade/compensation impact, and transition plan.

title: Remote/hybrid work agreement
prompt: Create a remote/hybrid work addendum for [Employee Name] detailing work location, on-site cadence, work hours and time zone expectations, productivity/availability norms, data security, device/expense policy, information security controls, and revocation conditions.

title: Leave approval letter
prompt: Draft a leave approval for [Employee Name] granting [Leave Type] from [Start Date] to [End Date], total [Days], with handover, contact expectations, and return-to-work instructions.

title: Leave rejection letter
prompt: Write a leave denial for [Employee Name], citing objective reasons (business criticality, insufficient balance, documentation), suggesting alternate dates, and reaffirming policy.

title: Return-to-work/fitness to work letter
prompt: Prepare a return-to-work confirmation for [Employee Name] resuming on [Date] after [Leave Type]. Include requirement for medical fitness certificate (if applicable), any accommodations, and reporting instructions.

title: Warning letter
prompt: Draft a formal warning to [Employee Name] describing incident(s), dates, violated policy clauses, employee response summary, required corrective actions, monitoring period, and consequences of recurrence.

title: Performance improvement plan (PIP) initiation letter
prompt: Create a PIP letter for [Employee Name] with objective performance gaps, SMART goals, resources/support, review milestones, success criteria, and possible outcomes (success, extension, or separation).

title: Show cause notice
prompt: Write a show cause notice to [Employee Name] outlining alleged misconduct/performance issues, facts and evidence summary, policy references, and requiring a written explanation by [Deadline], offering right to be heard.

title: Termination letter
prompt: Draft a termination letter for [Employee Name] effective [Date], specifying grounds (with/without cause, redundancy), notice pay/waiver, final settlements, benefits cessation, asset return, access revocation, and statutory compliance.

title: Relieving letter
prompt: Prepare a relieving letter confirming that [Employee Name], [Job Title], has been relieved effective [Last Working Day] after handing over duties. Mention employment tenure, conduct (if appropriate), no-dues clearance, and thanks.

title: Experience certificate
prompt: Create an experience certificate for [Employee Name] stating tenure from [Start Date] to [End Date], last designation, key responsibilities/skills, and overall conduct (if policy permits).

title: Background verification consent/request letter
prompt: Draft a BGV consent/request for [Candidate/Employee Name] authorizing verification of identity, education, employment, address, and criminal records via vetted vendors, explaining purpose, data handling, retention, and contact.

title: Policy circular/communication
prompt: Write a policy circular announcing [Policy Name] (e.g., POSH, WFH, Information Security) with scope, effective date, key clauses, do’s/donts
